title: Create the Gapminder dataset
text:
# Import necessary libraries
import pandas as pd
from gapminder import gapminder

# Rename 'lifeExp' to 'life_expectancy' and 'gdpPercap' to 'gdp_per_capita'
gapminder = gapminder.rename(columns={'lifeExp': 'life_expectancy',
                                      'pop': 'population_millions', 
                                      'gdpPercap': 'gdp_per_capita'})

# Convert population to millions
gapminder['population_millions'] = gapminder['population_millions'] / 1_000_000

# Create a new pandas DataFrame from the modified gapminder data
gapminder_df = pd.DataFrame(gapminder)

# Save the DataFrame as a CSV file
gapminder_df.to_csv('gapminder.csv', index=False)

# Print the first 3 rows of the DataFrame
print(gapminder_df.head(3))

import seaborn as sns

title: Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
text:
In this analysis, we explore the relationship between life expectancy and GDP per capita using the Gapminder dataset. The graph below shows how these two variables are related over time.

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
gap = pd.read_csv('gapminder.csv')

sns.set(style="whitegrid")

plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
sns.scatterplot(data=gap, x='life_expectancy', y='gdp_per_capita', hue='year', palette='viridis', legend='full')

plt.title("Life Expectancy vs GDP per Capita Over Time", fontsize=16)
plt.xlabel("GDP per Capita", fontsize=12)
plt.ylabel("Life Expectancy", fontsize=12)

plt.show()

title: Country Analysis: Afghanistan
text:
In this analysis, we explore the changes in life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population for Afghanistan over time. The graph below shows the trends for these three variables from 1952 to 2007.

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

gap = pd.read_csv('gapminder.csv')

afghanistan_data = gap[gap['country'] == 'Afghanistan']

sns.set(style="whitegrid")

fig, ax1 = plt.subplots(figsize=(12, 6))

sns.lineplot(data=afghanistan_data, x='year', y='life_expectancy', ax=ax1, label='Life Expectancy', color='b')

ax2 = ax1.twinx()
sns.lineplot(data=afghanistan_data, x='year', y='gdp_per_capita', ax=ax2, label='GDP per Capita', color='r')

ax3 = ax1.twinx()
ax3.spines['right'].set_position(('outward', 60))  
sns.lineplot(data=afghanistan_data, x='year', y='population_millions', ax=ax3, label='Population', color='g')

ax1.set_xlabel('Year')
ax1.set_ylabel('Life Expectancy', color='b')
ax2.set_ylabel('GDP per Capita', color='r')
ax3.set_ylabel('Population (Millions)', color='g')

plt.title("Trends in Life Expectancy, GDP per Capita, and Population for Afghanistan", fontsize=16)

plt.show()

title: Gapminder Dataset Description
text:
The Gapminder dataset contains 142 countries, and provides values for life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population, every five years, from 1952 to 2007 for each state.

Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
Life Expectancy and Population
Country Analysis

title: Life Expectancy and Population
text:
In this analysis, we explore the relationship between life expectancy and population size using the Gapminder dataset. The graph below shows how life expectancy relates to population over time.

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

gap = pd.read_csv('gapminder.csv')

sns.set(style="whitegrid")

plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
sns.scatterplot(data=gap, x='life_expectancy', y='population_millions', hue='year', palette='coolwarm', legend='full')

plt.title("Life Expectancy vs Population Over Time", fontsize=16)
plt.xlabel("Population (Millions)", fontsize=12)
plt.ylabel("Life Expectancy", fontsize=12)

plt.show()
